alert.note: Alert for Clark; Edwards; Ford; Hodgeman; Kiowa (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ford, western Kiowa, southeastern Hodgeman, southwestern Edwards and northern Clark Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 200 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Jetmore to 6 miles north of Fowler. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Minneola around 210 AM CDT. Spearville around 215 AM CDT. Bloom and Bellefont around 220 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Offerle, Kingsdown, Kinsley, Lewis and Centerview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Kansas.
